attributes.action: Abolish the Fixed Term Parliaments Act!
attributes.additional_details:
Its introduction on to the statute book upset the balance of power between the executive and the legislature.
It is time it was abolished so that Prime Ministers can call a General Election when they feel the timing is right for them to do so.
attributes.background:
Former PM David Cameron introduced the FTPA so that Prime Ministers could only call a General Election before the end of a scheduled 5 year term if a two thirds majority of MPs was achieved. 
The FTPA is an act of constitutional vandalism.
